alert.note: Alert for Durham; Orange (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 07 at 5:08PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Localized flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Durham and Orange. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 506 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated widespread moderate rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Durham, Chapel Hill, Carrboro, Bethesda, Parkwood, Eno River State Park, Gorman, Research Triangle, Jordan Lake, Rollingview Marina and Falls Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
